subject: Software Quality Assurance and Testing - Lecture 9
topic: API Testing, REST, SOAP, and Tools

questions.question: What does API stand for?
Where does the API layer sit in software application development?
options: Between the database and the server
Between the presentation (UI) layer and the database layer
questions.correct_answer: Between the presentation (UI) layer and the database layer

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of API testing regarding language independence?
options: Data is exchanged via XML and JSON, so any language can be used for automation
It requires C# for all tests
questions.correct_answer: Data is exchanged via XML and JSON, so any language can be used for automation

questions.question: How does API testing contribute to faster releases?
options: It executes tests up to eight hours faster compared to UI testing
It removes the need for developers
questions.correct_answer: It executes tests up to eight hours faster compared to UI testing

questions.question: What is 'Fuzz testing' in the context of API testing?
options: Forcibly inputting huge amounts of random data (noise) to create negative behavior
Verifying the correct product was built
questions.correct_answer: Forcibly inputting huge amounts of random data (noise) to create negative behavior

questions.question: Which type of testing is attacked by a person with limited knowledge of the API to analyze the attack vector from an outside perspective?
What does CRUD stand for?
Which HTTP method is used to implement a CREATE operation?
Which HTTP method is used to implement a READ operation?
What is the difference between PUT and PATCH for the UPDATE operation?
options: PUT updates the entire entry; PATCH updates only part of the entry
PATCH updates the entire entry; PUT updates only part of the entry
PUT is for creating, PATCH is for deleting
questions.correct_answer: PUT updates the entire entry; PATCH updates only part of the entry

questions.question: Which SQL command corresponds to the READ operation?
Which category of HTTP status codes indicates 'Success'?
What does a 4xx HTTP status code indicate?
What does a 5xx HTTP status code indicate?
Unlike SOAP, REST doesn't have to use XML. What other formats can REST use?
Which of the following is an advantage of REST over SOAP?
options: It uses XML for all messages
It is faster (no extensive processing required) and uses smaller message formats
questions.correct_answer: It is faster (no extensive processing required) and uses smaller message formats

questions.question: SOAP relies exclusively on which format to provide messaging services?
Which of the following is an advantage of SOAP compared to REST?
options: It is language, platform, and transport independent (REST requires HTTP)
It uses JSON which is lightweight
It has a smaller learning curve
questions.correct_answer: It is language, platform, and transport independent (REST requires HTTP)

questions.question: RestAssured is a library used to test REST APIs using which programming language?
What is 'Load testing' in the context of API testing?
options: Ensuring the API performs exactly as supposed to
Seeing how many calls an API can handle
questions.correct_answer: Seeing how many calls an API can handle

questions.question: Which testing type ensures the API produces consistent results and the connection between platforms is constant?
In a NoSQL database like MongoDB, which method is used for the CREATE operation?
Which protocol did Microsoft originally develop SOAP to replace?
What is a characteristic of 'Validation testing' in APIs?
options: It focuses on whether the correct product was built and if the API behavior is correct
It focuses only on security flaws
It inputs random noise into the system
It tests only the load capacity
questions.correct_answer: It focuses on whether the correct product was built and if the API behavior is correct

questions.question: What allows RestAssured to integrate well with project builds?
Which HTTP status code range indicates 'Redirection'?
Which of the following is NOT a standard HTTP method used in REST?
What is 'Security testing' often grouped with?
Which tool is mentioned for API documentation and UI visualization?
What does 'GUI-independent' benefit of API testing imply?
options: API testing can only be done after the UI is ready
API testing can be performed prior to GUI testing, allowing early feedback
API testing requires a graphical user interface
API testing tests the GUI elements
questions.correct_answer: API testing can be performed prior to GUI testing, allowing early feedback
